title: 32k-Mile 1993 Acura NSX 5-Speed
description: This 1993 Acura NSX was first delivered to Zimbrick Acura in Middleton, Wisconsin, and it was sold by the late original owner's family on BaT in September 2022. It shows 32k miles following registration history in Wisconsin, Montana, and California, and it was purchased by the seller in September 2024. Work since that time has included replacing the timing belt, drive belts, water pump, spark plugs, and tires. The car is finished in Formula Red over black leather and is powered by a 3.0-liter VTEC V6 paired with a five-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes staggered-diameter 15" and 16" forged wheels, a limited-slip differential, a black roof panel, pop-up headlights, power-adjustable seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, a Bose sound system, and a Boss Audio head unit with Bluetooth and Apple CarPlay connectivity. This NSX is now offered with the owner's manual, service records, an indoor car cover, spare parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 32k-Mile 1993 Acura NSX 5-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #201,053.
text: This 1993 Acura NSX was first delivered to Zimbrick Acura in Middleton, Wisconsin, and it was sold by the late original owner’s family on BaT in September 2022. It shows 32k miles following registration history in Wisconsin, Montana, and California, and it was purchased by the seller in September 2024. Work since that time has included replacing the timing belt, drive belts, water pump, spark plugs, and tires. The car is finished in Formula Red over black leather and is powered by a 3.0-liter VTEC V6 paired with a five-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes staggered-diameter 15″ and 16″ forged wheels, a limited-slip differential, a black roof panel, pop-up headlights, power-adjustable seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, a Bose sound system, and a Boss Audio head unit with Bluetooth and Apple CarPlay connectivity. This NSX is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, an indoor car cover, spare parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name. The NSX featured aluminum bodywork, and this example is finished in Formula Red with a black roof panel and pillars. Features include pop-up headlights, an integrated rear wing, side air intakes, power-adjustable side mirrors, and dual exhaust outlets. Photos showing paint-meter readings are included in the gallery. Staggered-diameter 15″ and 16″ five-spoke forged wheels were mounted with Hancook Ventus V2 Concept2 tires in October 2024. The car features a four-wheel double-wishbone suspension with front and rear stabilizer bars, and braking is handled by NSX-branded calipers over vented rotors at each corner. The cabin features power-adjustable sport seats upholstered in black leather. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, and a Bose sound system. The Boss Audio head unit features Bluetooth and Apple CarPlay connectivity, and the removed stereo is included in the sale. The stainless-steel door sill plates are stamped with the car’s serial number. The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a tachometer with an 8,000-rpm redline, a 188-mph speedometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 32k miles, approximately 400 of which were added under current ownership. The mid-mounted 3.0-liter V6 features VTEC variable valve timing and was factory rated at 270 horsepower and 210 lb-ft of torque. Service in October 2024 involved replacing the timing belt, tensioner bearing, water pump, drive belts, and spark plugs. Power is routed to the rear wheels via a five-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The transmission fluid was also changed in October 2024. The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage. Head over to our friends at Car and Driver to check out their May 1994 Road Test for the NSX. html:
This 1993 Acura NSX was first delivered to Zimbrick Acura in Middleton, Wisconsin, and it was sold by the late original owner’s family on BaT in September 2022. It shows 32k miles following registration history in Wisconsin, Montana, and California, and it was purchased by the seller in September 2024. Work since that time has included replacing the timing belt, drive belts, water pump, spark plugs, and tires. The car is finished in Formula Red over black leather and is powered by a 3.0-liter VTEC V6 paired with a five-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes staggered-diameter 15″ and 16″ forged wheels, a limited-slip differential, a black roof panel, pop-up headlights, power-adjustable seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, a Bose sound system, and a Boss Audio head unit with Bluetooth and Apple CarPlay connectivity. This NSX is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, an indoor car cover, spare parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The NSX featured aluminum bodywork, and this example is finished in Formula Red with a black roof panel and pillars. Features include pop-up headlights, an integrated rear wing, side air intakes, power-adjustable side mirrors, and dual exhaust outlets. Photos showing paint-meter readings are included in the gallery.

Staggered-diameter 15″ and 16″ five-spoke forged wheels were mounted with Hancook Ventus V2 Concept2 tires in October 2024. The car features a four-wheel double-wishbone suspension with front and rear stabilizer bars, and braking is handled by NSX-branded calipers over vented rotors at each corner.

The cabin features power-adjustable sport seats upholstered in black leather. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, and a Bose sound system. The Boss Audio head unit features Bluetooth and Apple CarPlay connectivity, and the removed stereo is included in the sale. The stainless-steel door sill plates are stamped with the car’s serial number.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a tachometer with an 8,000-rpm redline, a 188-mph speedometer, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, voltage, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 32k miles, approximately 400 of which were added under current ownership.

The mid-mounted 3.0-liter V6 features VTEC variable valve timing and was factory rated at 270 horsepower and 210 lb-ft of torque. Service in October 2024 involved replacing the timing belt, tensioner bearing, water pump, drive belts, and spark plugs.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a five-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The transmission fluid was also changed in October 2024.

The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.

Head over to our friends at Car and Driver to check out their May 1994 Road Test for the NSX.
